laboratory_examinations.findings: Lipase level: 2731 U/L (no reference range provided, but typically elevated in pancreatitis).

A 9 x 5 x 8 mm hemangioma in the left hepatic lobe (unchanged from prior exam). No new focal lesions or textural abnormality in the liver. No signs of ascites or biliary dilatation. CBD measures 3 mm. Gallbladder collapsed with stones. Pancreas unremarkable.
